dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Is that your name?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: No. It’s a false identity.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Okay. You’ve been read your rights...

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: My guy is coming.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: You haven’t made a call. No-one knows you're here. H says nothing. FIORINI slides a picture of YOUNGER towar

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Can I ask you, do you recognize him?  H looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Yes. FIORINI just nods, her smile giving nothing away.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Is this your screw-up? FIORINI . You have a first name you can give me? A real one? H sighs and shakes his head. Okay, let's Slay the game, all smiles, make nice to me, you know how it goes. You can call me H. What's your first name, Fiorini?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Felicity.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh that’s so cute, now we’re such good friends, right? VINCENT ; Attempted murder is not a joke.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Your agents came to my home, my children were there. If I wanted to kill them, I could have. (to FIORINI) You have made a serious mistake.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: The Agent you shot, he identified himself as FBI?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: I didn’t get a chance to check him.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: So you did shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh, Felicity, you are so good at this.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He could have died. You gave him coagulant to stop the bleeding, morphine for the pain.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: I’m a Saint. 17.  18.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You have those things just lying around the house?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Well thank you, H, you did the right thing. You said you recognized him? She points casually to the picture on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Yes. From the TV. The door opens. BAINES walks in, with CHARLIE and EVE ZAC elegant woman of 45. FIORINI and VINCENT are confused.

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: Agent Fiorini, we have received instructions. This interview is suspended.

dialogues.speaker: H, (TO CHARLIE)
dialogues.text: You bastard, I RELY ON YOU. You Sir, what do vou mean? Wh told me, one hundred per cent, these people? We can’t jus those were not our guys.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE BAINES
dialogues.text: Your name got on some NSA list, We have to surrender the CIA gave it to FBI, no-one told suspect. me.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: There’s been a foul-up. It seems this “gentleman” is on our side. He’s going to be working the same investigation. I am what? ZACHARY (re BAINES ) I can’t believe you let this happen.

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: You sent us his file, don't blame FBI.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY, (TO FIORINI)
dialogues.text: Did you check your leads against the witness protection program, like the priority” list with all the red tags saying "Do not touch"?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT BAINES
dialogues.text: He’s in witness protection? We didn’t have time for that!  19.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: We put him there so you would leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (TO FIORINI)
dialogues.text: Hi, we talked. I’m Charlie... You can all_ qo fuck vourse Last year H had a contract out I told you I would never w on him. with you people again.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (TO FIORINI)
dialogues.text: Two quvs from Chechnya, we got This is never, now is neve to them first. are coming with us.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE BAINES
dialogues.text: He’s a target, he thought your When you've finished with guys were killers... you can be sure we won’t have.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Mister Baines, you do what you like, but right now he comes with us.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, he dam near killed one of our agents...

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: We have other priorities.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You what!

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: Let it go, Fiorini.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Charlie, put him in the car, now. ZACHARY leaves. CHARLIE goes to the door and holds it ope

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: Fiorini, this investigation is being transferred to another facility.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: That’s crazy, we’re set up right here!

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: We have orders. I expect leadership from you, not resistance. FIORINI swallows it. H sighs and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re both getting screwed. H heads for the door, but FIORINI gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Who are you?  20.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Best not to ask. CHARLIE and H leave. BAINES is left with the two agents.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I’ll prepare my team for transfer,Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two black SUV’s on the road. Inside them are FIORINI and LEONARD, JACKSON, PHILLIPS. Also SUTTON, a young security officer, in dark suit, shades, and earphones. The SUV’s steer into a gap in a concrete wall. Gates clos them. Uniformed personnel and dogs scan the vehicles. The SUV's drives into a walled compound, a former militar Some of the buildings are derelict and boarded up. They p outside a large building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a large lobby area, which is buzzing, packed w suits and military. MPs guard every door, and all the cor

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: SUTTON
dialogues.text: Need to know, you don’t. This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the new FBI room, the old suspect boards are being set suits and military personnel. On the walls are the images YOUNGER, and the three different basement rooms. The AGEN

dialogues.speaker: SUTTON
dialogues.text: This is where you work. At this point I will take your firearms from you.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You’re not taking my weapon. Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: SUTTON
dialogues.text: Listen, lady, just hand over the gun.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You call me “Agent”. And you try taking my weapon, I will shove it right up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Let her keep the dam thing. GENERAL GUNTER is there, a bull of a man. VANDERBIDEN is him, a civilian, pompous and overweight. SAUNDERS is behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir. This is General Gunter, Commander, Sitcon.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: You’re Fiorini?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Agent Fiorini. He looks at her. A woman.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: FBI is here to assist with investigative duties under my command.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: No Sir, Posse Comitatus. Unless the President has invoked Martial Law, the military has no jurisdiction over civilian authority.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Defence Authorization Act 2007. You may have missed the small print. Tell her, Mister Saunders. Saunders looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: President has the authority to use the armed forces in order to suppress, in any State, any insurrection, unlawful combination or conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Can we get on with this? VANDERBIDEN gives SUTTON a tape, which he puts in a VCR. and H enter the room. The agents are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Hello Felicity. Isn’t this fun?

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: Welcome. This is the Situation Control Center. My name is Vanderbiden, I’m with the Department of Homeland Security. Two days ago we received.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Play the fucking tape. The tape begins. FIORINI stares at H, who smiles, 21.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: and points at the screen. FIORINI hears the voice and turns to watch. On the tape, the image of YOUNGER appears. He is in what like a basement room, standing in front of a large device  22.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: In the name of Allah the merciful, and his prophet Mohammed, 1 gace be upon him. My name is Yusuf Atta Mohammed. My former name is William Arthur Younger. All the rest you will learn from your files. This is location one.

dialogues.speaker: SUTTON
dialogues.text: We took a screen capture of all the locations, cleaned them up, took him out of it. And took that thing out.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Some of you will recognize this. It is a bomb. FIORINI gasps. The location and sound changes on the tape

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: This is location two. All the locations are in urban areas. I have demands which will be met by you, or these bombs will explode. TI will give you these demands at a later date. The location and sound change again.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: This is location three. All three devices are identical. All three will explode in seven days, on Friday the 21st at lpm. And all three of these devices... are nuclear bombs.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Your experts will want evidence, of course, so I will now describe the technical aspects of each device. YOUNGER begins to go through the details. SUTTON mutes th

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: We'll spare you the details. After 9-11, iP there’s a one per cent chance, the threat is considered real. This one is 99 per cent. He’s one of us. A military scientist, specialist in field nuclear weapons. Served in Iraq with Special Forces to check out nukes. A grade ‘A’ guy, top honors, totally dedicated.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: His father is American. Worked at the embassy in Pakistan, met a woman there, became a Moslem so he could marry her, forced to leave the Diplomatic Corps. They had a son in (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUNDERS (cont'd) Pakistan, then moved back here, the son was granted citizenship.. And the boy just got the normal background check. After all it would be so wrong for anyone to suggest that Islamic terrorists have one thing in common - they're all Islamic. H laughs at himself. The others look at him with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: This is not funny.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: He’s made no demands, no further contact.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Where could he get nuclear material?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Three years ago he was on a team checking nuclear facilities in Russia.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Oh, great choice.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Since then, some material has gone missing The Russians can’t trace about fifteen, eighteen pounds, they can’t be accurate. Around five pounds on each bomb. Three big cities.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI, (TO SAUNDERS)
dialogues.text: Sir, do we have any direct evidence that he’s for real? SAUNDERS turns to GUNTER, who sighs, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: The Iranians paid him twenty million to get nuclear material out of Russia and bring it back to them. They \se set the whole thing up. Then they lo track of him, and the money.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: How do we know this?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: They told us. One of their Generals was a little concerned. We might think they were responsible for what Younger does with the stuff. Nice excuse to bomb the crap out of them.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What does he want? Why did he do it?  24.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Jesus, the question is not “why he did it”,but “where are the fucking bombs”?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You think you can answer one without the other?

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: His wife is a liberal type, environmental nut. She wanted a divorce, he didn’t. He tried to take their two kids back to his Mother in Pakistan. The court stopped him, gave custody to the wife. Maybe that turned him, we don’t know. At some point he became a fundamentalist.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He wants to nuke us because we took his kids?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: You mess with my family, I’d feel the same way.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: I have copies of his restricted file. VANDERBIDEN hands out files. FIORINI grabs hers and scans

dialogues.speaker: H, (TO CHARLIE)
dialogues.text: Everything I need in here?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: You’1l inform me of any developments?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Not much point if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: We need you to get back to work. But you even whisper the word nuclear, and you'll be withdrawn immediately. Understood? FIORINI looks up from the file, angry.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You knew all this and you didn’t tell us? We could have cracked this before it even happened.  25.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: Intelligence couldn't put the pieces together.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: But that’s exactly what we do!

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: So how come our people found his home.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Maybe because they had the file, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: I sent Agent Vincent down there. We have forensics working on it now. You better take a look.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER, (TO H)
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Will someone please tell me who this person is?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Just do your job, Fiorini. FIORINI looks at H. H smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI, H and CHARLIE go through the house with VINCENT. lifeless, bare. Family photos, parents, a blonde wife wit kids, military buddies in fatigues. An American flag on t ERT technicians in plastic suits are still working. H see

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: They peeled this place apart. This guy is so clean, he’s weird.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Nothing out of place. Everything as it should be. The female cousin, Aliah Mustafa. No trace of her?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: No other prints, no fibers, no hair. Just him.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: That’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Someone cleaned it real good. CHARLIE and H move on. FIORINI speaks quietly to VINCENT.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Did Military Intelligence go through this place before we did?  26.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I think we can assume that.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on? And you, why the hell didn’t you tell me you'd been sent here?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: They told me not to. FIORINI shakes her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Are they trying to replace me with someone else - like you?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Nobody else could lead this investigation, we don’t have time to mess around, and you have all the inside tracks. Yes, they asked me, and that’s what I told them.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Thanks. Sorry. VINCENT . It’s not personal, Fliss. I just hope I did the right thing. VINCENT looks at her. She avoids his gaze and goes into t room. She sees H, leaning against the wall, arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: So are you some kind of investigator? (H smiles) You don’t seem to be interested.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Charlie gives me all the information I need. I like to keep my focus clear on the subject.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What subject? Who are you people?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The Service.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What service? What agency?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No agency wants any part of us.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: We’re private contractors.  27.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m the contractor, you’re just a sub- contractor.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh, right, I’m a sub-contractor.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We do stuff. No office, no oversight, no fuss.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: There must be legal limits to your organization?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess there must be. They laugh. VINCENT enters.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: You better see the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a large garage workshop. Machine tools, chain nuke suits, engineering rigs.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: They say the bombs were made here. Traces of radiation, three types including enriched uranium.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: To what level?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Safe enough to walk around, that’s all I know.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He made three nuclear bombs in this garage and all we have is trace levels of radiation?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Maybe he had another place.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: There’s nothing here, is there? Charlie, can we get to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUTTON leads them into the Conference Room. Full of milit civilians in earnest discussion. GENERAL GUNTER is arguin furiously with SAUNDERS, but he stops talking as they app  28.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: You’ve seen the house?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: That’s a scary place. You must have been pleased when you got him. GUNTER turns on him in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Why are you wasting my time, General?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Who told you we have him? Who?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: I’m here. You called me in. So obviously...

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Wait here. GUNTER goes, leaving SAUNDERS, who is clearly seething wi CHARLIE laughs, FIORINI is confused.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Wait, what is this, we’re searching the whole country for this guy?

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: These idiots have had him 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Why didn’t they say? How was he caught?

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: A security officer saw him in a mall.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: His picture is plastered all_over the country, and he goes to a mall?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Sure, Macy’s returns department. “I’m sorry, this uranium you sold me is just not enriched enough...” SAUNDERS looks at H in disgust and takes FIORINI aside.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: Listen. The Military need us to investigate, get the accomplices, find the bombs, but they want to interrogate the suspect themselves. They’re allowing one agent inside... GUNTER and COLONEL KERKMEJIAN approach.  29.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: This is Colonel Kerkmejian: Military Intelligence. He’1ll take you to him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: Fiorini, you report back only to me. FIORINI looks at SAUNDERS. GUNTER is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: You're sending her!

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: She’s leading the investigation: she goes in. General, you’ll have to let us interrogate him, and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: FBI will get access to the prisoner as soon as he becomes available. GUNTER turns to FIORINI, H and CHARLIE.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Until then, that man is ours. You observe, and that is all.

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Follow me, please. KERKMEJIAN leads FIORINI, CHARLIE and H, who turns to FIO

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: They don’t seem to want you guys around, do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KERKMEJIAN leads down a corridor, which gets increasingly and dark. There is an MP at the door ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Who exactly is interrogating this man?

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Other Government Agencies have that in hand. (to H) I don’t know your work, but they tell me you broke the Chechen case?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MP opens the door, and they walk into the back of the This might once have been the base Assembly Room. Seats a tables, with a crowd of military and civilians. At one en INTERROGATION ROOM, with an air-lock door, and a wall of  30. FIORINI gasps. IN THE ROOM is YOUNGER, naked, hooded. He eagled, leaning angainst the wall on his fingérs. Water i over his hood, he is gasping for breath. Cold-air fans bl at him, and he shivers uncontrollably. An_ interrogator, ORDEN, is dressed in a warm coat, and o relay we hear his insistent questions. KERKMEJIAN speaks

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: This is the Interrogation facility. The subject is in there, soundproof, one- way glass. We have experts from multiple agencies, the mi itary, nuke specialists, psychologists, analysts every word and movement he makes.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Any psychics in here?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Shut up, H.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Why not, they got everything else.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Who’s in charge here? This is illegal!

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: We never strike him. Hot and cold, sleep deprivation, intense noise, bright eghts, threats of violence.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh, he must be terrified. Where are the dogs, there should be dogs...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Who gave you authorization to...

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Everything here is within operational parameters, Agent.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Colonel, if you decide to use H, he can’t work with all these people.

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN, (SMILING)
dialogues.text: You want us to get rid of the others?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: That won't be difficult. H walks to the front of the Hall. KERKMEJIAN, CHARLIE, an follow. A stir, as some recognize him, and others whisper name. FIORINI sees the disgust on their faces. One stands

dialogues.text: You’re not serious? Tell me he's not here.  31.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Charlie, the amateurs are in charge, this won’t work.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You may have to make it work. They’re going to need you on this one.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Make it work? Okay. (He smiles at Fiorini) Let’s make it work. H looks at the crowd of experts. VANDERBIDEN is squashed seat. In the front row is ZACHARY. Next to her is LUBITCH fatigues, six foot four of muscle. An older, QUIET MAN si side, a cane in his hand. H turns to look through the gla FIORINI looks too. The little details of a naked, sufferi Suddenly H steps forward, opens the outer door to the Roo steps inside. He opens the inner door before anyone can s

dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh shit. IN THE ROOM, ORDEN is surprised by H’s arrival. He clearl recognizes him. H glances out towards othe Hall. From ins Room, nothing outside can be seen. goes straight to YOUNG pulls him upright, and rips off his hoo YOUNGER blinks in ight, shivering with cold as the water cascades down his

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Hello. ORDEN is furious, but covers it. H picks up the night sti lies on the table, and turns to face YOUNGER. ORDEN is al

dialogues.speaker: ORDEN
dialogues.text: No. No way! H swings round and HITS ORDEN IN THE FACE. ORDEN flies ag the wall. H follows up with a series of vicious strikes. sprays across the Room. YOUNGER’S eyes, watching, amazed. IN THE HALL, they are paralyzed for a second.

dialogues.speaker: LUBITCHICH
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: M.P.'s, now! There is a rush for the door of the Room. IN THE ROOM, H is pulled outside by two MP’s, WINSTON and LUBITCHICH picks up ORDEN’s unconscious body and carries IN THE HALL, H is put face down on a table, as the MP’s c  32.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t hurt him!

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? I didn’t strike the prisoner. H looks at FIORINI, gestures to the Room. She seizes the

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI VANDERBIDEN, (TO H)
dialogues.text: Colonel, the suspect is now Are you out of your mind? You available for interview, I’m just assaulted an interrogat going in.

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: What? No, I don’t have authorization.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Then get it. I’m sure you don’t intend to obstruct the FBI. She takes out her pistol and places it on a table.

dialogues.text: Where the hell is Lubitchich? pointing to H) And get him out of here! H flashes FIORINI a smile, as the MP’s hustle him away. S into the Room, as KERKMEJIAN picks up a phone. IN THE ROOM, YOUNGER remains leaning against the wall, ch a_ stress position. He is naked, wet, and shivering. He l FIORINI, in her sharp FBI suit.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Mister Younger, I am Agent Fiorini, FBI. As soon as I can, I’m getting you out of this, so we can sit down and talk. You’ve been badly treated, and I’m sorry. YOUNGER replies, with a strange calmness.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: It’s not okay. You have grounds for legal gomplaint ; and if you want to, I’ll help you make it.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Necessary?  33.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: In the war against terror. FIORINI is taken aback. She turns off the cold fan, gets and dries his back. IN THE HALL, the observers watch. KERKMEJIAN is on the ph

dialogues.text: What the hell is that woman doing?

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Yes Sir, she’s in there now... IN THE ROOM, YOUNGER still shivers as FIORINI dries him.

dialogues.text: Thank you. Could you please dry my arms, they’re really col FIORINI does so. As she reaches up, he looks quickly at h She notices. She smiles at him, almost teasing.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: 6.15 Sunday evening. Have you found my wife and kids yet?

dialogues.text: You must be worried about them.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: You’re looking for them, right? When you find them, will you let me know?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I can help you with that. Can you help me with something? Why are you doing this, Mister Younger?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Yusuf. My name is Yusuf.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Alright, Yusuf. What is it you want? The door swings open. GUNTER is there, with LUBITCHICH. A KERKMEJIAN, who looks very uncomfortable.

dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here. (to LUBITCHICH) And you, get some fucking results! You.

You pull in every contact, you make every possible connection. But the absolute priority of you and your (MORE )

And’ this guy Vincent, iS he that other agent? The cell-block door opens for GUNTER and CHARLIE. As a GU up the cell, H slips the file to CHARLIE, who grins at FI

dialogues.text: Like hell we won't!

dialogues.text: How long can you keep that up?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: As long as it takes. Do we pull him out of country?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: We have a place here.  38.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh that’s a little risky, how about the Road to Marrakesh? Or Guantanamo, I have friends there.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: We don’t have time for that and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: That’s right. Time, time, time, it’s such a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Take this seriously, you little fuck. H leans into GUNTER. There is something deadly in his fac

dialogues.speaker: H

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Abso-fucking-lutely not!

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: I’m the last possible choice that you would want to make, General. But you’re going to have to make it.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER, (TO FIORINI)

dialogues.text: No. They look. The QUIET MAN is there in the shadows, observi

IN THE BASEMENT, amazement, then panic.

dialogues.text: No honey you should. You want to go, that’s fin IN THE CELL, YOUNGER writhes in agony as he tries to brea against the tape. H takes a scalpel and puts a small hole tape between YOUNGER’S lips. Desperately, he sucks in a t stream of air. It just prolongs the agony. H turns to ALV

dialogues.text: You worked for me before. Remember the Chechen girl? You cleaned up for me.

dialogues.text: Sure it was. You can leave now. ALVAREZ goes. H rips the tape from YOUNGER’S mouth, and h for air. H picks up a blade, and leans into his face. Are you ready for this? No. No-one ever is. Al your nightmares, your worst fears. they’ re all here. A moment of silence, as H lowers the blade. We do not see YOUNGER looks into his eyes. This can’t be happening. The that H makes is so smooth, so slow, that he gasps, before experiencing unimaginable pain. Then comes the scream. IN THE BASEMENT, KERKMEJIAN, VANDERBIDEN and FIORINI can’ what they are seeing. CHARLIE and ZACHARY just watch.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Get General Gunter here right now! VANDERBIDEN picks up a phone. The screams go on.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: This is beyond any legal limits.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What limits do you think that bastard has?  46.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Colonel, I know the law, military and civilian. We signed the United Nations Convention against torture, the Geneva Conventions...

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: The law is the Military Commissions Act which says that no unlawful enemy combatants may invoke the Geneva Conventions. The screams go on. FIORINI has to shout.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Sure it does, but unlawful combatants have no right to Habeas Corpus, which means they can’t bring any claim to court, so how do they prove it?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: No, the MCA refers to alien unlawful enemy combatants. He is an American Citizen.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: He was granted citizenship. That was revoked yesterday. He’s an alien.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You can’t DO that!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (MIMICS)
dialogues.text: “You can’t DO that” A voice makes her turn.

dialogues.speaker: QUIET MAN
dialogues.text: For Chris’sake there are three... nuclear... bombs. You know what that could do to our country? VANDERBIDEN puts down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN

dialogues.text: He says WHAT? Suddenly, H comes out of the Cell. He nods to ALVAREZ, wh back in. The screams have become whimpers.

dialogues.text: We could do this our way. Our methods work.

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: What?  63.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He’s asleep.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: Oh God, we need H back in here.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Push the dam button.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: That would be direct intervention, and I’m not...

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: The bastard’s not supposed to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Fiorini, why don’t you do it?

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: I’1l do it KERKMEJIAN stands beside the switch, his finger poised. T him. He pushes the switch. Immediatély the darkened Cell with sparks, as YOUNGER’s body arches into the air in ago

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: That’s enough. Turn it off! KERKMEJIAN flicks the switch repeatedly. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: I can’t!

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Oh God, it’s killing him. KERKMEJIAN rips the wires from the switch-box. No effect. all rush for the door of the Cell. INSIDE THE CELL, YOUNGER is arched upwards» shaking. Ther cables all over the floor. One is pulled from a socket. N

dialogues.speaker: KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: Where is it? Where the fuck is it? They search desperately for the socket. KERKMEJIAN tries the cables from YOUNGER’S body. He electrocutes himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Suddenly the current shuts off. Smoke and stench. YOUNGER on the table, and looks into FIORINI’s eyes, pleading.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI comes out of the glass door. TRUMAN is on guard t walks fast, straight to the tree. There, H and RINA sit t watching a DVD of KATIE and PETER. H holds a cell-phone, teddy bear, and a child’s painting.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, that’s so kind of you.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You bastard! H covers the phone, as the DVD plays on with children’s v

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Would you mind? (to the phone) Yeah I’m watching xou right now, Mummy brought the DVD. nd Peter sent baby bear to see me, will you thank him? Listen I have to go, Mummy will be back soon. I love you darling. Yes you can turn it off. Bye honey, bye. (he turns off the phone) Current ran for 15 seconds, he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You fixed it. You're playing with us, you... You all tried to save him, didn’t you. I wanted him to see that.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Are you going to find these fucking bombs?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: No, you are. I’m just part of the process. (to RINA) See you tomorrow. H turns off the DVD player, and picks it up, with a bag o He takes his wrapped sandwich, touches RINA’s shoulder, a

dialogues.speaker: RINA
dialogues.text: My husband needs you. I_am jealous, I wish I could help him. If he fails, it will be bad, yes? FIORINI turns her back and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI reaches the steel door, where WINSTON now stands

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Soldier, you've covered your name tag.  65.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: I don't want anyone here to know my name. What you're doing in there, is it right?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Is it necessary? FIORINI cannot answer. Inside, the SCREAMS begin again.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: No limit to what a democracy must do to protect itself.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: You actually believe that shit? FIORINI looks at him. She takes a deep breath, then goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What FIORINI now sees on the monitor is the worst thing s ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Oh no... As the continuous screams of unspeakable agony echo aroun FIORINI tries not to retch. VANDERBIDEN gets up.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: I can’t do this, I shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh no, Homeland Security is leaving us. What if there’s a hurricane? VANDERBIDEN hurries out of the door. FIORINI confronts ZA

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Alright, that’s it. I demand to be allowed to question the prisoner. If you refuse, I will hold you personally responsible... The voice of H calls over the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: H, (ON SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Felicity! Felic...ity! Would you come in here’ please? I need a little help. FIORINI is horrified.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: Looks like you got your chance. IN THE CELL, YOUNGER is strapped to the chair, his wrists down. H uses a plastic sheet to cover his body and his ha sits. FIORINI comes in, very slowly. He beckons her close

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Just here. She moves closer, then sees a blood-soaked bowl of human fingernails. She retches. H puts a cloth over the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: What are you willing to do? Look at her, Yusut. Look at Miss America. If she could get you to talk, that really would be something, wouldn't it? YOUNGER breathes harder, pulls against his restraints.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Oh. Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: __.FIORINI
dialogues.text: Now you listen, I’m not...

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: You any good at massage? It would be very helpful. She can't believe what he is asking.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: No, not me - him. His neck muscles are in spasm. Please? He needs a break. She walks slowly around the chair. She puts her hands on neck. He flinches. She starts to massage.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Mind if I play some music? H turns on his DVD player. It is Haydn’s “Surprise” Symph starts softly, then later it bursts into life. H pops a p

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: You want one of these, keep you going? FIORINI shakes her head. He moves close to her, drops a c pills in the pocket of her blouse.  67.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Take some for later. Go as deep as you can, he’s blocking the pain, I don't want to lose sensitivity right now. She realizes his reason for doing this, and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Don’t stop. You’re easing his pain. She starts again. H is very close to her.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Some subjects can take it from a male, but a woman just cracks them up. I had a nurse who used to assist me. FIORINI is about to speak, but stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: She must have been as sick as I am, right? That's why I married her. FIORINI looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Did Rina tell you what happened to her family? FIORINI nods. She continues the massage. She tells total strangers sometimes. It's embarrassing. Her people took the village back the next day. They captured the three men responsible, and their families. She killed the wives, and the children, in front of the men. She then tortured them for three days. Just when our troops arrived, she killed them. The army ut her in jail, but they needed a avor, so they passed her on to me. We Americans are wonderful. So man morals, absolutely no ethics. Rina and I were a good team. She could help me now, but she has to look after the children. Take them to school, tuck them up, kiss them good night... YOUNGER breaks into heaving sobs.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: THAT’S what I want! e pulls the cloth aside, and immediately applies pincers of YOUNGER’S fingernails. FIORINI moves back so fast she DVD player on the table, stopping the music. YOUNGER scre so does FIORINI, hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNGER turns to her in agony.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Please? She gets as close to YOUNGER’S face as she can bear.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I can stop him, but you have to talk to me. You have to give me something!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I'll talk. Please, I'll talk, I‘1l talk! H stops, and turns to FIORINI with a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Good girl... IN THE BASEMENT, the observers are stunned. They stand an YOUNGER, as he strains to speak.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I_am now willing...to make a statement of my terms...to the President and People of America.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI is back with her team.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I want a full psychological report, voice analysis on every word he says. We need to compare this with every piece of video we have. And we asked or the security camera tape of his arrest, why the hell don’t we have it?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I’ll track it down. The team break up as SAUNDERS approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: He’s ready. We have a live feed in the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I‘1ll get down there.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: You got him to talk. At last. FIORINI avoids his eye.  69.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Sir, I don’t know if it was me...

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: You did well, Fiorini.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI enters. The observers watch the monitor, IN THE C YOUNGER is strapped to the chair, in a fresh shirt, and w hat, a blanket over his body. ALVAREZ stands close "py. S framed a camera just on his’ face.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is_a waste of time. We put him in front of a camera lets a break that’s what he Teese Now he'll offer us a deal, we consider it, more time.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: That’s crap. If he talks at all, that’s progress. And we don't make deals with terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: We do it every day. And they always ask the impossible. Bomb Israel, elect a homosexual president, stop killing animals.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He'll say he's been tortured, we’ll deny it, he’ll want a broadcast, we'll refuse it, he’1l make crazy demands, and we'll reject them. What’s the goddam point? The monitor now shows the close-up of YOUNGER’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SUTTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, you can speak anytime. In the Basement, the observers watch the video feed, as Y speaks, slow but clear, getting better as he goes on.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Mister President... I am currently being held on charges of terrorism. I am Muslim, but I ama loyal American, I love my wife... (he chokes up) I love my kids, I love my country Since my capture, I have been well treated by the splendid men and women of our armed forces and police.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck...  70.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I do not require you to broadcast this statement. That would set a dangerous precedent. I have placed three bombs in three American cities. I will reveal their locations when you make the following three public announcements. First, that no further financial support will be given to puppet regimes and dictatorships in any Islamic nation. Second, that the US will withdraw all our forces, from all Islamic countries. Third, that the US will sign the Kyoto protocols on global warming. H can’t believe what he is hearing.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I am here for you, and available to egotiate a reasonable time-frame for all of these demands. Mister President, I greatly admire you, I know you want to stop wasting taxpayers’ money supporting murderers. I know you want to ring our boys home to the nation that we love. Thank you, and God Bless America. The observers are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: QUIET MAN
dialogues.text: We’re in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room as_ before, but this time with H present, his he his hands. Everyone talking at once, shouting each other

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: We cannot give in to terrorists! I'm saying we could pers we are willing to consider...

dialogues.speaker: . FIORINI KERKMEJIAN
dialogues.text: He didn’t ask for a broadcast, ...being seen to be workin don’t you see what that means? towards his objectives.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: If this was released to the public he knows we could never make a deal with him. He wants to negotiate! ; ZACHARY . Negotiate! Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: He's crazy. Islamic terrorists don’t give a shit about global warming.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He’s trying to impress his wife.  71.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: By exploding three nukes?

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Alright, so what do we advise the White House?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Take the deal.

dialogues.speaker: VANDERBIDEN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: His terms are reasonable, achievable, and the American people would agree with them.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Which is why Y you can be dam sure they won't get to hear them.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Well maybe they should.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: You two, on me please. GUNTER, SAUNDERS and ZACHARY huddle around the Quiet. MAN privatély. The others are left out. H looks wiped out

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Charlie, do something. We’re running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Less time. Believe me, that's what you want. FIORINI looks at them both - what was that about?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You guys are whipped, aren’t you.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You’re not going to break him.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: We'll find some little key that fits his lock.  72.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: You’11 kill him first.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If he wants to be a martyr, he will be. He knows how this is going to end.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI / /
dialogues.text: What do you mean? This man is going to face trial.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Felicity... how could they prosecute a man with no fingernails? FIORINI is shocked. GUNTER comes out of the huddle.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Alright, pending further consultation, I believe we can assume that the current protocols of interrogation continue until otherwise directed by higher authority. iH In other words, you want me to go on, without telling me to go on. Right? H stands. FIORINI leaves the room, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI enters THE CELL. YOUNGER is still dressed for his

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Yusuf...how is it? His voice is weak, but he is strangely calm.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I’m fine. I’m feeling just fine.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Yusuf, you_could make a deal. You got these people cold. They can’t take you to court, don’t you see? Not like this. They can’t admit what they did. You can get out of this. You give us your accomplices, you tell us where he bombs are, we put you on a flight to Pakistan.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: With my kids?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: They’1l negotiate. No-one outside knows this ever happened. Give us the bombs, you could be free! H enters, with ALVAREZ.  73.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want to be free. Don’t you et it, Fiorini. He put himself here, e knew what we'd do to him.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: The only thing he wasn’t expecting was me.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Yusuf, tell me where the bombs are. Make the deal!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: The bombs...will explode if my terms are not met. But they will be. No other choice. You have to tell them that, Fiorini... H_ jams a gag into YOUNGER’s mouth, and pulls his blanket ALVAREZ prepares some clamps. YOUNGER gags, eyes staring

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: you really don't want to be here for is. FIORINI leaves. IN THE BASEMENT, she heads for the door, as on the monito begins an agonizing scream. ZACHARY calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARY
dialogues.text: You have no authority to make any kind of deal with that man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIORINI, fighting exhaustion, paces as she talks with her team. A board with a map of the world leans against a cha marks and strings of tape all over it.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: CIA are liaising with foreign intelligence sources. We got him in Yemen, Pakistan, Russia, all over. He used several passports, he_ got sloppy, left traces all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Can we put him and the nuclear material together at any time?

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: There’s a ton of circumstantial. The Russians don’t know exactly..  74.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He had fifteen, eighteen pounds of it. That's not easy to transport.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: He had a lot of money. Paid somebody for something.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Sure, but for what? We need to know where he spent it? Deejay? Another board goes up - a map of the USA, with just a few

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Not so good. He came back in through New York, we have him there, Washington, Chicago. And one sighting in Dallas. That was Phil.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Phil?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I figured he’d need a truck, I got a room full of people checking every rental agency. We got lucky with one of his aliases.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Okay, keep driving it on, Deejay, you push on those bank transfers. The meeting breaks up.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: That’s good work, Phil. Don’t let them rush you. Detail, you’re good at that.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: But they got so much on their map, how come we got nothing on ours? PHILLIPS goes. FIORINI stops. She looks at the two maps. looks around her, at the room full of urgent chaos. VINCE in, holding up a tape.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: The tape you wanted. Younger’s arrest. TIME CUT TO LATER. FIORINI watches a grainy tape, of YOUN walking into a mall. He looks around, and then sits on a

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: How long does he sit there?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Twenty-three minutes, Security told the cops, they came in to get him.  She hurries 75.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: He walks in, he looks around, he sits directly in front of a security camera, and he stays there for twenty- three minutes. My God. H is right. over to SAUNDERS and BAINES.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Sir, have you seen those maps?

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: Yes, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Everything | here is laid out for us. His house is like a stage set, with just enough nuclear residue. He has traceable links with terrorist contacts. He travels the world, we can follow every step: But he comes back home, he covers his tracks like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: We have no direct evidence that he possesses nuclear material.

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: Except a video with three bombs on it.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: And he knows how to make them look just right, doesn’t he. He’s a clever guy. So clever he gets himself caught the day after he sends in the video? (she points to the monitor) He sits in a mall. His picture is everywhere, including | on the TV in that store, right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUNDERS
dialogues.text: Intelligence have no doubt. He had the time, the means, the capability, the contacts, the finance...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: When intelligence agencies look for conspiracies, the ind them. We look for evidence - and we don’t have it.

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Some guy waves a toy gun in the air and forces us to shoot him. Suicide by Police. What about torture by government?  76.

dialogues.speaker: BAINES
dialogues.text: So he got himself captured so we could torture him. He was prepared for that, was he? Is that what you’re saying? FIORINI stops cold. Thoughts racing through her head.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: No. That’s what he said. “I’m prepared”, that’s what he said. I need to get back in there. She hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CELL, YOUNGER is choking. He is on the chair, his stretched open by a metal contraption. H is working on hi FIORINI enters, and tries hard not to retch.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: We agreed I was not to be interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: I need to speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: You'll have your chance later...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Get that fucking Ghang out of his mouth and LEAVE THIS ROOM! H looks at her. Suddenly he unhooks and removes the contr from YOUNGER’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: Sure. He’s all yours. H strolls out of the Cell. YOUNGER blubbers like a child, blood, tears and snot. FIORINI moves behind him. She talk softly, close to his ear, caressing his hair.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Just us now. I know, Yusuf. I know about the bombs. You’re very skilful. You can fake up a nuke for a video, right? You left a great trail for us. But no evidence.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: No. The bombs are real...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Alright, give me one. Go on, prove it, give me just one.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: You don’t want me to give you proof. Please, make them see, they have to agree to my terms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody believes you, Yusuf, they’r only doing this crap because they want your accomplices. If the bombs are real, then give me one!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Don’t ask me for proof...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Then they’1l know the others are real. They're ready to crack, they’1l give ou what you want. You'd be suc ero, your wife would come back, your kids would love you. You let yourself be captured. You knew what they might do. And they did it. YOUNGER is weeping uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: I...I won't...

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: But you did one better. You proved that we are exactly the kind of people you say we are. Look what they did to ou. You are a hero. You’re the ravest man I know. But it’s over now. There are no bombs. Are there?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: No. No. There never were... 77. YOUNGER weeps in despair, letting it all out. Suddenly, F wants to throw up. She controls it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: There are no bombs. I just want my wife, my kids, please, there are no bombs!

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Why did you let him go on, you could have told me anytime. YOUNGER gasps, then breaks again.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Because I deserve it. I fucked up so bad. My wife, my religion, my country. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: The nuclear material, you have any?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Couple of ounces. I made the bombs, there was nothing in them.  78.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Where did you shoot the video? No, don’t tell them, just me. Whisper it in my ear. She takes out a pen and paper, and with trembling hands, address as he whispers it. Then she shows it to YOUNGER.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER
dialogues.text: Yes. Please don’t let him hurt me anymore. Please. YOUNGER weeps. She leaves. IN THE BASEMENT, the observers stare at FIORINI, as she p phone and punches in a number. She stares back at them.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: It was a hoax. A goddam hoax. I’m going to nail you people to the wall. (to the phone) Sir, I need a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Washington street is cordoned off by police. Incident t there. A helicopter lands, VINCENT and FIORINI head for D Chief BERMAN, busy giving orders. They shout over the noi

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Hi Fred, this is Agent Fiorini.

dialogues.speaker: BERMAN, (TO FIORINI)
dialogues.text: Berman, Deputy Chief.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: So what do we have?

dialogues.speaker: BERMAN
dialogues.text: Hazmat are still in there. It’s huge, a rabbit warren. We got to go slow, we're checking for mines, booby traps.

dialogues.speaker: FIORINI
dialogues.text: There won’t be any. VINCENT. We can’t be sure of that, you take your time.

dialogues.speaker: BERMAN
dialogues.text: We intend to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
